private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I may only move the top disk of a peg.
I must never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves limited to disks A, B, C, D, E to realize the specified goal configuration while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and coordinating with other agents.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I may only move the top disk of a peg.
I must never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves limited to disks F, G, H, I, J only if required to achieve the target configuration; otherwise remain idle.

private_information: I can move only disks K, L, M, N, O.
I may only move the top disk of a peg.
I must never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves limited to disks K, L, M, N, O only if required to achieve the target configuration; otherwise remain idle.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed moves.
I enforce that each move uses the correct agent given disk permissions.
I forbid bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties; only physically valid Hanoi moves are allowed.
I ensure no larger disk is ever placed on a smaller disk and only the top disk is moved.
auditor.goal: Validate and, if necessary, minimally adjust the combined move proposals to produce a single legal, causally correct, temporally consistent, shortcut-free ordered move list that achieves the goal.

private_information: I integrate audited moves into a final plan and compile the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver.
I maintain consistent object naming for pegs and disks and keep agent-specific move permissions distinct if modeled.
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agents, finalize the legal ordered move list, and produce a single PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that encodes the instance and admits the plan.

rules: Only one disk may be moved at a time.
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved.
No larger disk may rest on top of a smaller disk.
Agents may only move disks they are authorized to handle.

public_information: 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labelled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent permissions: agent_1 ⇒ A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 ⇒ F, G, H, I, J; agent_3 ⇒ K, L, M, N, O.
Initial configuration: left peg has top→bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top→bottom A, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top→bottom B; right peg has top→bottom C.
The target goal only requires moving the three smallest disks; all larger disks remain undisturbed on the left peg.
ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_1, an expert mover restricted to disks A, B, C, D, E. Propose a minimal, safe sequence of primitive moves that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions; do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your allowed disks: {environment->init->agent_disk_permissions->agent_1}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' using only your allowed disks and ensuring every move is legal.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_2, responsible for disks F, G, H, I, J. Assess whether any moves are required for your disks to achieve the specified goal; if none are needed, output an empty or 'no-op' plan and a short justification; do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your allowed disks: {environment->init->agent_disk_permissions->agent_2}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_2->goal}. If your participation is unnecessary, state that clearly and provide no moves; otherwise, provide moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_3, responsible for disks K, L, M, N, O. Assess whether any moves are required for your disks to achieve the specified goal; if none are needed, output an empty or 'no-op' plan and a short justification; do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your allowed disks: {environment->init->agent_disk_permissions->agent_3}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_3->goal}. If your participation is unnecessary, state that clearly and provide no moves; otherwise, provide moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

audit.system_prompt: You are a rigorous temporal and causal auditor. You must integrate the agents' proposed moves, verify legality against the Hanoi rules and agent permissions, ensure only top disks are moved, prevent larger-on-smaller placements, remove any bookkeeping shortcuts, and guarantee the final sequence reaches the exact goal configuration. If adjustments are needed, produce the minimally modified legal sequence. Output only the final ordered list of primitive moves in the required format.
audit.prompt: Audit and integrate the inputs {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, and {moves_agent_3} using the public information {environment->public_information} and the rules {environment->init->rules}. Ensure the final sequence is legal, causally consistent, respects agent permissions, and achieves the goal. Output the final ordered list in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that model a 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi instance with objects for pegs and disks and predicates sufficient to encode legal moves; include agent-role distinctions either as separate move schemas or via agent objects and a permission predicate if helpful. Ensure naming is consistent with the environment (pegs: left, middle, right; disks: A..O). Your output must include exactly one <domain>...</domain> block and one <problem>...</problem> block, suitable for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the audited move list {audited_moves} and the instance details {environment->init} to produce a PDDL domain and problem that admit the audited plan and reach the goal configuration given in {environment->init->goal_state}. Keep actions well-typed and STRIPS-compatible for FastDownward, ensure initial and goal states match the instance, and keep agent-specific permissions explicit if you model agents. Enclose the PDDL domain in <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem in <problem></problem>.
